intro: Azarolus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy azarolus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Azarolus pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
